body_html: Yup, you can pass tf.ConfigProto(allow_soft_placement=True) to the tf.Session if you really want to ignore device placement directives in the graph. I'm not a huge fan of using this option (I'd rather the graph be rewritten to strip out the device fields explicitly), but that should work.
body_text: Yup, you can pass tf.ConfigProto(allow_soft_placement=True) to the tf.Session if you really want to ignore device placement directives in the graph.  I'm not a huge fan of using this option (I'd rather the graph be rewritten to strip out the device fields explicitly), but that should work.
body: Yup, you can pass tf.ConfigProto(allow_soft_placement=True) to the tf.Session if you really want to ignore device placement directives in the graph.  I'm not a huge fan of using this option (I'd rather the graph be rewritten to strip out the device fields explicitly), but that should work.
